articles.author: The Briefings Team
articles.title: Your Morning Briefing: Standouts
articles.description: Highlights from a year in Briefings world
articles.content:
Good morning.
Today were bringing you a special edition of the Briefing, which looks back at 2019 with the help of you, our readers. Were revisiting some of your favorite articles and features, and highlighting some that you might have missed.
One of our go… [+1069 chars]

articles.author: Jon Pareles
articles.title: Pop Music in 2019: An Escape From Isolation?
articles.description: Over the last decade, pop’s sonic spaces grew isolated and claustrophobic. But this year the pendulum started to swing back toward solidarity, and even a glimpse of optimism.
articles.content: Music conjures spaces: churches, theaters, roadhouses, arenas, pubs, dance halls, living rooms, festival tents, and all sorts of clubs, from tenement basements to cabarets to giant warehouses. Those are social spaces, where musicians perform together and audi… [+1138 chars]

articles.author: Aurelien Breeden
articles.title: Symbol of Malaise or Traffic Amenity? The French Go Round and Round
articles.description: Traffic circles are everywhere in France, accepted as safer than traditional intersections. But they have also become an emblem of the country’s ailments, from urban sprawl to inequality.
articles.content:
It was once the site of a sugar refinery so large that in May 1940, after German bombs set it on fire, 35,000 tons of sugar were transformed into caramel, sending residents rushing into the street with pots and pans to scoop up the precious syrup.
Like many … [+1263 chars]

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: Afghan Official Says Taliban Abducted 26 Peace Activists
articles.description: The police are trying to find and free the abducted activists whose convoy was going from village to village to rally for peace.
articles.content: The Taliban, who have been active in Farah, have not claimed responsibility for the abductions. However, Mr. Watandost also said that tribal elders in the province immediately launched an effort to negotiate with the Taliban to release the abducted activists.… [+831 chars]

articles.author: Amanda Cormier
articles.title: Wiktoria’s Secret: The Best Bras Might be Made in Poland
articles.description: A reporter’s pilgrimage to the land of meticulous sizing and pretty embroidery.
articles.content:
In 2008, Julia Krysztofiak-Szopa started an online Polish discussion forum bra community called Balkonetka. Thousands of women posted detailed reviews and photos of their bras.
A few years later, she moved from Warsaw to Palo Alto, Calif. When she looked for… [+1167 chars]

articles.author: Derrick Bryson Taylor
articles.title: Black Rhino Born at Michigan Zoo on Christmas Eve
articles.description: Doppsee, a 12-year-old black rhino, gave birth to her first calf, a rare delivery in captivity for the critically endangered species.
articles.content: The worlds black rhino population declined by 98 percent from 1960 to 1995, falling to a historical low of less than 2,500, largely because of European hunters and settlers, according to the World Wildlife Fund. The species has doubled in population since the… [+874 chars]

articles.author: Manohla Dargis
articles.title: ‘Clemency’ Review: No Place for Mercy
articles.description: A tremendous Alfre Woodard plays a warden at a prison whose world is upended by the fate of death-row inmates.
articles.content: Sometimes acting seems like possession. Thats how Alfre Woodards performance in Clemency feels as she violently sweeps you up with the force of her talent. It takes a while before you grasp how deep shes gone. As Bernadine Williams, a warden at a mens prison,… [+2185 chars]

articles.title: Paying Too Much for That College Textbook
articles.description: Publishers, an author and a student offer their perspectives.
articles.content:
Amy BadrockSan Jose, Calif.
To the Editor:
Thank you, Tim Wu, for helping me set the record straight. I am a lifelong textbook author, and my writing is a full-time job. My books dont qualify for tenure. Academia denigrates textbooks as second class. Author… [+948 chars]

articles.author: Zach Montague
articles.title: G.O.P. Senator ‘Disturbed’ by McConnell’s ‘Total Coordination’ with White House
articles.description: Senator Lisa Murkowski of Alaska revealed the first public qualms with Mitch McConnell’s vow to coordinate with the White House on a quick impeachment trial for President Trump.
articles.content: Instead of prolonging the process, House Democrats moved forward with articles of impeachment based on evidence already collected, formally accusing Mr. Trump of abuse of power and obstruction of Congress. In a Senate trial to consider removing Mr. Trump from… [+1759 chars]

articles.author: Jeffrey Moyo and Rick Gladstone
articles.title: ‘We’d Prefer the Food’: Zimbabwe Fears a Famine Is in Its Future
articles.description: Government dysfunction, an economic meltdown, drought and a calamitous flood  have plunged Zimbabwe into a hunger crisis.
articles.content: I cannot stress enough the urgency of the situation in Zimbabwe, Hilal Elver, an independent United Nations human rights expert on food security, said after a 10-day visit in November. Sixty percent of the countrys 14 million people, Ms. Elver said, are food-… [+836 chars]

articles.title: A Low Day at the High Court
articles.description: A constitutional lawyer says the justices have proved more loyal to the president than to the rule of law. Also: Women’s activism; the Republicans and climate change.
articles.content:
To the Editor:
Re The Party That Ruined the Planet (column, Dec. 13): 
Thanks to Paul Krugman for using his power as a columnist to try to do good. Mr. Krugman lays out the facts of climate change and the terrifying but predictable rate at which it is setti… [+1188 chars]
